title: Sefton Resources moves to fight bankruptcy case
text:

Fri, Aug 28, 2015, 12:00 BST - UK Markets close in 4 hrs 30 mins Sefton Resources moves to fight bankruptcy case By Victoria Young | Sharecast – 3 minutes 4 seconds ago 0.0001 0.0000 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - US oil and gas company Sefton Resources (LSE: SER.L - news ) has moved to fight a bankruptcy claim brought by a former board member, and claimed the action was brought in bad faith. The company has filed an application to dismiss the bankruptcy application brought by former executive chairman James Ellerton, Sefton said in a statement It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) was also seeking fees, costs and punitive damages from Ellerton, who Sefton alleged brought the application in bad faith. 
In separate litigation, Sefton wanted damages from Ellerton based on allegations and misconduct and unlawful activities during and after his time at the company. 
Shares (Berlin: DI6.BE - news ) in Sefton were down by 10.89% to 0.401p at 0905 BST.
